result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas G Korb was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked, the jail sentence may be served with huber.  Court grants out-of-county service and out-of-county travel.

miscConds.notes:
-AODA assessment and any follow-up.
-No Contact with the victim.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas G Korb

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from Tammi Cassidy (Green Lake County DHHS) dated August 2, 2017 re:  completion of AODA assessment (CONFIDENTIAL)

10:35 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty David Bolles.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites ageement - defendant will plea to count 1 and count 2 will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Atty Bolles concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Court orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Bolles.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

30 days county jail, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 1 year.  Out of county service and out of county travel.  Huber if revoked.

CONDITIONS:

-AODA assessment and any follow-up.
-Court costs.
-No Contact with the victim.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 10:43 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 31, 2016 at 10:00 am.

11:36 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Dave Bolles.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Bolles - requests an other hearing.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on May 31, 2016 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 11:37 a.m.,
Status hearing on April 18, 2016 at 11:30 am.
from Atty David Bolles requesting the hearing scheduled on 03/29 be rescheduled due to a conflict (FAX COPY)

8:45 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Atty David Bolles present on behalf of the defendant.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Bolles confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Atty Bolles stands mute.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  Statement by the Court in regards to recusal.  Court notes bond has been set.  Court will set for Status Hearing on March 29, 2016 at 11:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 8:47 a.m.

No Contact with Roger S.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.
Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail

No Contact with Roger S.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.

1:07 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and with Atty David Bolles present in court.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds probable cause.  Statement by Atty Bolles, received a copy of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court questions defendant regarding address and employment.  ADA makes bond recommendation.  Court orders $1000.00 signature bond and No Contact with Roger S.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant to appear in court on January 19, 2016 at 8:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 1:11 p.m.
